UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Biological characterization of two novel cathelicidin-derived peptides and identification of structural requirements for their antimicrobial and cell lytic activities.
Literature.Author: Skerlavaj B, Gennaro R, Bagella L, Merluzzi L, Risso A, Zanetti M

Literature.Title: In vitro and in vivo antimicrobial activity of two alpha-helical cathelicidin peptides and of their synthetic analogs.
Literature.Author: Benincasa M, Skerlavaj B, Gennaro R, Pellegrini A, Zanetti M

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=1µM),Escherichia coli ML-35(MIC=0.5µM),Salmonella enterica subsp. enterica serovar Typhimurium ATCC 14028(MIC=1µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=0.5µM),Serratia marcescens ATCC 8100(MIC=4µM),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=8µM),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=>=64µM),Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 12228(MIC=2µM),Bacillus megaterium Bm11(MIC=2µM),Candida albicans(MIC=8µM),Cryptococcus neoformans(MIC=4µM),Enterococcus faecium(MIC=16->32µM),Streptococcus agalactiae(MIC=1-2µM),Serratia marcescens(MIC=0.5->32µM),Escherichia coli O18:K1:H7 Bort(MIC=2µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=2µM),Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=>32µM)
